name: caesarean
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an operation in which the uterus is cut open to allow a baby or baby animal to be born: I had to have a Caesarean. The only way to deliver the baby safely would be to perform a caesarean. The baby was born by Caesarian section. Synonym
C-section
More examplesFewer examplesThis group of women was at 25% greater risk of needing a Caesarian.After about 14 hours of labour she was given a Caesarean section.The twins were delivered by caesarian.The sheep farmer may be unwilling to pay a vet to perform a caesarean.

involving or related to a Caesarean: a Caesarean birth/delivery a caesarean scar An analysis of current birthing statistics show that caesarian intervention has increased in recent years.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was advised to opt for a Caesarean delivery.What is the reason for the high number of caesarean births at the hospital?The threat of litigation may be a factor in high caesarean rates.I have a couple of birthmarks and a Caesarean scar.
